mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lyrics from song/album "In the Aeroplane Over the Sea," by Neutral Milk Hotel, cited in previous photo. Unattributed lyrics from "Living in the World Today," by Gza. Homophobic invective of a third-party named Yates (also insulted in Carrel 3-2 and 2M-4, poor guy); with two responses. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
But for now we are young | If you livin' in the world today, you be hearin' the slang that the Wu-Tang say | Yates is gay | no, he's just flamboyant | FITZHUGH 340S â™¥ | You misspelled Yeats
